description: Surrogate primary key uniquely identifying the shift record.
Business shift code or short name used to categorize schedules.
Human-readable description of the shift’s schedule or purpose.
Planned start time of the shift (time basis may be local; confirm).
Planned end time of the shift; may roll into the next day for overnight shifts.
Start time of the second segment for a split shift; null for continuous shifts.
End time of the second segment for a split shift; null for continuous shifts.
Total scheduled hours for the shift across all segments; confirm whether unpaid breaks are excluded.
Free-text notes about the shift definition or special rules.
System timestamp when this shift record was last updated.
Hour component of the shift’s planned duration.
Minute component of the shift’s planned duration.
Likely timestamp of the last user-initiated modification; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user or process that created the shift record.
Timestamp when the shift record was created.
Identifier of the user or process that last modified the shift record.
Timestamp when the shift record was last modified by a user.
